Summary: The 3 West Club is in an excellent location, near Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, and many restaurants and theaters. The hotel offers comfortable, clean rooms and a nice breakfast, but does not have amenities like room service.
The 414 Hotel is in a central location near Times Square and Restaurant Row, with breakfast included, providing a convenient and easy stay. The hotel is small and intimate with friendly staff.

60 Thompson has a rooftop bar with views of the city and a restaurant on-site, making it easy to have drinks and meals without leaving the hotel. The hotel's concierge is helpful in booking reservations and providing information about the area.

6 Columbus is in a great location near Central Park and many subway lines, making it easy to get around. The hotel is next to a Starbucks, Duane Reade, and Whole Foods, which is convenient for quick meals and snacks.
70 Park Avenue Hotel is in an excellent location, close to Grand Central Station, and several subway stops. Some reviewers enjoyed that the location was quiet.
The hotel offers complimentary breakfast including coffee and croissants. There is a bar and lobby area, as well as room service from nearby restaurants.

The hotel is well-located near public transport, so most attractions are easily accessible by walking or subway; many guests also found the staff to be helpful in arranging transport. The hotel has a lounge where breakfast is available in the morning, and wine is served most evenings.
The hotel is in a great location on E. 34th street near the 6 train, shops, and restaurants. The rooms are spacious with kitchens and the staff are friendly and helpful.
Affinia Gardens provides menus in the rooms and offers fast in-room delivery from several local places. Housekeeping is preformed daily and kitchens are included in each suite.

The Affinia Manhattan is in an ideal location, with easy access to transportation, Penn Station, Times Square, and various attractions, making it easy to explore the city. There is also a dedicated info area during core hours.

The Affinia Shelburne is in an ideal, central location near Grand Central station, allowing one to walk to many attractions, and near transportation to get anywhere in the city; some suites include a kitchenette. The hotel offers amenities to customize your stay and the staff is helpful.

AKA United Nations offers well-equipped apartments with full kitchens, and provides complimentary breakfast on weekdays. The hotel is near a corner store and a supermarket, and is within walking distance of Grand Central Terminal.

The Algonquin Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Broadway, making it easy to walk to many attractions; however, some rooms are small and there may be construction noise. It has a lobby where all-comers revel in the history and ambience.

The Americana Inn is centrally located near Times Square, Macy's, and the Empire State Building, with easy access to subways, and offers clean but small rooms. The hotel is budget-friendly, but some rooms can be noisy due to street traffic.
Amsterdam Court Hotel is in a great location near Times Square and the subway. Rooms are small, some without much natural light or views, but are up-to-date and cleaned daily.

The Astor on the Park is a budget-friendly, basic hotel located across from Central Park and near subway stations, making it easy to get around Manhattan; however, it is a bit far from downtown and offers minimal amenities. Guests recommend it as a clean and efficient place to sleep while exploring the city.

The Bedford Hotel is located near Grand Central Station, with many attractions within walking distance. Some rooms include kitchenettes with a fridge, microwave, and coffee maker, and there are numerous cafes and deli outlets nearby.

The Beekman Tower Hotel offers spacious suites with fully equipped kitchens, with a grocery store across the street. It's located in a quiet, safe, residential part of Manhattan with many restaurants and bars nearby.

The Belleclaire Hotel is located on the Upper West Side, close to Central Park and multiple subway lines, with the Manhattan Diner across the street offering room service. The hotel offers a variety of rooms including suites and shared-bath options, some with mini-fridges, iPod docks, and flat-screen TVs.

The Bentley is located in a quiet, safe, residential neighborhood on the upper east side, a bit far from the main attractions, but with a bus stop right outside. Rooms include modern design, clean bedsheets and towels, and comfortable beds, with the best views from higher floors.

The hotel offers a complimentary continental breakfast and is conveniently located near many restaurants in Chinatown and Little Italy. It is also close to multiple subway stations, providing easy access to other parts of the city.

The Best Western Convention Center Hotel offers complimentary continental breakfast and free Wi-Fi, making it convenient for guests who prefer not to plan meals or activities. The hotel provides basic amenities like coffee makers and safes in the rooms, and is located within a 15-minute walk of Times Square and Penn Station.

Best Western Hospitality House is an apartment-style hotel with kitchens stocked with breakfast items, offering a convenient start to the day. Its central location allows for easy access to attractions like Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and Central Park.

The hotel offers complimentary continental breakfast, free Wi-Fi, and is located near South Street Seaport with shops and restaurants. It is conveniently located near the subway, the Brooklyn Bridge, and Lower Manhattan attractions.

The Blue Moon Hotel offers complimentary wine upon arrival and a continental breakfast with bagels, pastries, juice, tea and coffee. The hotel is located in the Lower East Side near Little Italy, Chinatown, and subway lines, and the staff can provide restaurant recommendations and directions.
The hotel includes a continental breakfast of bagels, muffins, pastries, coffee, tea, and juice. There is also 24/7 coffee available.

The Buckingham Hotel is centrally located near Central Park and multiple subway lines, making it easy to explore the city, and offers suites with kitchenettes, allowing for convenient in-room meal preparation. However, it should be noted that the hotel does not have its own restaurant or room service.

The hotel has a full-size refrigerator, microwave, coffee machine, and free DIY laundry facilities. The suites include a full-size refrigerator, two-burner electric stove, dishwasher, sink, dishes, utensils, cook pots, and coffee maker.
Carlton Arms is an affordable, art-focused hotel with a 24-hour front desk, but no TVs in the rooms. It is located in a safe, central location near subways, restaurants, and bars, but can be noisy.

The hotel is conveniently located near subway lines, a Starbucks, and a CVS drugstore, with plenty of food, drink, and deli options on the street. The staff are pleasant and can assist with directions.

Casablanca Hotel is lauded for its complimentary breakfast, 24/7 coffee and snacks, and an evening wine and cheese reception in Rick's Cafe, providing opportunities to relax and socialize without extra planning. Located just off Times Square, it offers a peaceful escape with friendly staff and a welcoming atmosphere.

The Chambers Hotel is in an excellent location near shops, dining, and attractions like Fifth Avenue and Central Park. The hotel offers amenities such as room service, a restaurant, and helpful staff for recommendations and reservations.

The Chelsea Lodge is a budget-friendly hotel in Chelsea with clean, small rooms, offering a convenient location near subway stations and various restaurants. Guests describe the hotel as a no-frills accommodation with a friendly staff, suitable for travelers seeking a simple place to stay while exploring the city.

Chelsea Pines Inn is praised for its convenient location near subway lines and various neighborhoods, making it easy to explore Manhattan without extensive planning. The inn offers complimentary breakfast, a daily newsletter with suggestions for activities, and a helpful staff that provides recommendations for restaurants and shows.

The Chelsea Savoy Hotel is noted for its convenient location near subway lines, making it easy to get around the city without extensive planning. It also offers complimentary coffee and pastries in the lobby, saving guests the need to immediately find breakfast elsewhere.

The City Club Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Grand Central, with a restaurant (DB Bistro Moderne) on-site, but room service is available from a diner down the street. The hotel offers free DVD rentals and provides cookies each night.

The Solita Soho is in a convenient location close to the subway, Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho. It's a smaller hotel with no bar, restaurant, gym, or business center, but it has clean, modern rooms with comfortable beds, free Wi-Fi, and flat-screen TVs.

Club Quarters Downtown is near several subway lines, making it easy to get around Manhattan, and offers a room service option where nearby restaurants will deliver food to the hotel. Some reviewers note the area is quiet, especially on weekends, with limited late-night dining options within walking distance.

The Club Quarters Midtown is in a central location, close to Times Square and Grand Central, with free WIFI and computer access in the lounge. The hotel is geared towards business travelers and offers a self-service check-in/out system.

This hotel is conveniently located near many attractions and subway lines, with room service available from local restaurants. It offers amenities such as free water, computers, and printing services.

The Comfort Inn Chelsea offers a complimentary breakfast with breads, hard boiled eggs, cereal, juice, milk and donuts, and is near many restaurants and shops. The hotel is conveniently located near subways, making attractions easily accessible.

This hotel's complimentary breakfast includes bagels, toast, cereal, juice, coffee, and pastries, and it is conveniently located near attractions like the Empire State Building, Macy's, and Times Square. With a subway station close by, the hotel provides easy access to various parts of the city.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge offers complimentary breakfast, free internet, and is conveniently located near multiple subway lines, Chinatown, and Little Italy. The hotel provides easy access to many attractions and transportation options, minimizing the need for extensive planning.

The Comfort Inn Midtown offers a free breakfast, free internet, a business center, and is centrally located near Times Square and subway stations. Some guests noted that the hotel rooms are small, but clean and well-equipped.

The hotel offers a free continental breakfast with items like waffles, cereal, pastries, and coffee available all day, and is located near many restaurants and Times Square. It is also close to subway stations and the Port Authority bus terminal.

The Comfort Inn offers complimentary breakfast with options like waffles and pastries, plus free coffee and juice all day, and is within walking distance of Times Square and Penn Station. It's noted for its small, clean rooms, friendly staff, and proximity to transportation, making it a convenient base for exploring the city without extensive planning.

The hotel includes a continental breakfast with items such as bagels, muffins, rolls, pastries, cereal, milk, cheese, preserves, honey, juice, coffee, tea and waffles. The hotel also offers free water, tea, and coffee in the rooms, with vending machines and ice available.

The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast buffet with a variety of options and facilitates ordering in from local restaurants since it doesn't have its own restaurant for room service. They also offer services like dog walking and room service for pets.
The Cosmopolitan Hotel is in an ideal location, close to subway lines, Ground Zero, and Battery Park, with a Starbucks downstairs. There are dining options nearby, and offers tidy rooms.

This Courtyard is centrally located near Times Square and subway stations, making it easy to get around Manhattan, and offers free coffee in the lobby. It is a standard business hotel with mostly predictable experiences, and the rooms have comfortable beds.
The Courtyard Upper East Side offers a pool, gym, and a restaurant, but no room service. The hotel is located in a quiet, residential area, but requires a 10-15 minute walk to the subway.
The Courtyard Marriott Fifth Avenue is centrally located with a deli next door that is open 24/7. There is free coffee and tea on the mezzanine level and free internet access.

This hotel is in a convenient location near the subway and within walking distance to many attractions, shops, and restaurants. The rooms are spacious and clean, with comfortable beds and amenities like free internet and coffee.

The Crosby Street Hotel is located in SoHo, close to subway, bus and Broadway. The hotel offers room service, concierge services for dinner reservations and outings, and a bar with a wide selection of drinks.

The Crowne Plaza Times Square is in a central location close to major attractions, Broadway shows, restaurants, and shopping, and many sightseeing buses pick up from outside the hotel. Access to the gym and pool, though there may be an extra charge, and some concierge levels include free wireless internet and snacks.

Da Vinci Hotel is in a great location, close to Central Park, Times Square, and subway lines; the hotel offers a basic continental breakfast, and there is a restaurant and bar downstairs. The hotel provides free internet access, and the staff can offer advice on choosing wine with dinner.

The Doubletree Guest Suites in Times Square is praised for its central location near subways, restaurants, and Broadway shows, making it easy to get around without much planning. Some reviewers appreciate the availability of a concierge and helpful staff for booking show tickets and tours.

The hotel is conveniently located near Penn Station, Times Square, and other attractions, making it easy to get around the city. Some reviewers found the hotel to be clean and modern, with comfortable beds and helpful staff.

The hotel is conveniently located near a subway station and within walking distance of major attractions such as Times Square and Central Park, offering quick access to the city's sites. The hotel is next to Metrocity cafe and has complimentary breakfast for Hhonors Gold members, breakfast buffet, and room service, with many nearby places to eat.
The hotel is centrally located near Times Square, Central Park, and subway stations. The hotel has a restaurant and bars, including a rooftop bar.
The hotel is located in the Tribeca area, close to subway lines for easy access to other parts of the city. The hotel is small, with a restaurant and bar in the lobby.

The Dylan Hotel is conveniently located near Grand Central Station, making it easy to access transportation and various attractions, with some guests noting the availability of amenities like room service. However, some reviews mention that the hotel restaurant may be closed or have limited service, so it might be necessary to plan for meals outside the hotel.

Eastgate Tower is centrally located near Grand Central Terminal, with grocery stores and restaurants nearby, and offers spacious suites with full kitchens; however, it lacks an on-site restaurant. Many reviewers found the location convenient for walking to attractions, and the suites ideal for groups or families who want to prepare their own meals.
The Econo Lodge Times Square offers complimentary breakfast, coffee, tea, and internet, potentially saving on extra costs. Some reviewers mentioned that the staff were friendly and helpful.

Embassy Suites offers free drinks every evening, free breakfast, and spacious suites with two rooms; several restaurants are connected, including Applebee's and Chevy's. It is a good place to stay if you don't want to leave the hotel, with a gym, movie theatre, and restaurants in the building.

The Empire Hotel has a convenient location with a Starbucks and Duane Reade next door, Ed's Chowder House, and P.J. Clarke's attached to the hotel, so there are many options to eat and drink without leaving the building. The Empire Hotel also has a rooftop pool and lounge and is located near Central Park and Lincoln Center.

The Envoy Club is an apartment-style accommodation with fully equipped kitchens, offering a home-away-from-home experience, but with limited hotel services like 24-hour front desk availability. It's located a few blocks from major attractions like the Empire State Building and provides spacious rooms suitable for longer stays.

The hotel offers a buffet breakfast and is conveniently located near the South Street Seaport and a subway station, providing easy access to uptown. It is also close to various diners and cafes, with a bus stop and subway station nearby for easy transportation.

The Excelsior Hotel is located in the Upper West Side, near Central Park and a subway station. No room service is available, but there are vending machines and nearby restaurants, delis, and coffee shops.
The Fairfield Inn offers a free continental breakfast, saving money compared to eating out. It is conveniently located near a subway entrance, providing easy access to various attractions.

The Fitzpatrick Grand Central is praised for its central location near Grand Central Station, making it easy to get around Manhattan without much planning. The hotel has comfortable beds and offers amenities such as a fridge, and coffee maker in the room.

The Fitzpatrick Manhattan is in a great location close to many attractions, shops, and subway stations, making it easy to get around. The staff are friendly and can provide recommendations and reservations.

The Flatotel is in midtown Manhattan, near Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and subway stations, with spacious rooms that include kitchenettes and free internet access in the business center; some packages include free parking. There is no need to plan for breakfast as it is available at the hotel, but it is vastly overpriced.
The Sheraton Chelsea is centrally located near subway and bus lines, making it easy to get around the city, and is within walking distance to many attractions. Free internet is available.

The Four Points SoHo is in a convenient location near subways and within walking distance of SoHo and Greenwich Village shops and restaurants. The hotel has a small bar, restaurant, and fitness center, as well as free Wi-Fi and Starbucks coffee in the rooms.

The Four Points Times Square is conveniently located near the Port Authority bus terminal and subway lines, providing easy access to transportation and various parts of Manhattan. The hotel offers amenities like free internet, and is within walking distance to Times Square and other attractions.

The Four Seasons in New York is known for its excellent concierge service, assisting with various needs such as restaurant reservations and transportation. The hotel also offers packages, such as the "Kids for all Seasons" package, that include amenities and services designed to cater to families.

Gild Hall is located in the Financial District near subway lines, making it easy to access different parts of the city. It offers comfortable rooms, and many reviewers praise the staff's friendliness and helpfulness.
The Gramercy Park Hotel offers amenities such as room service, a rooftop lounge/garden, and the Rose Bar. The hotel can be dark and may require reservations for the Rose Bar.

The Grand Hyatt is centrally located, next to Grand Central Station, and connected to the terminal providing easy access to subway lines and shops. There are several food options nearby including restaurants and a food court, and guests appreciated the hotel for being a convenient spot for sightseeing in midtown.

The hotel offers complimentary snacks and non-alcoholic drinks in the minibar, and some reviewers mention a complimentary continental breakfast. Room service is available, and the hotel restaurant, Locanda Verde, is highly rated.
The Hampton Inn offers complimentary breakfast, 24/7 coffee, tea and juice, and free WiFi. The hotel is centrally located near a subway stop, Macy's, and the Empire State Building.

The Hampton Inn offers complimentary breakfast, coffee, and tea all day, which many reviewers found adequate and convenient. The hotel's location near Penn Station and other attractions allows guests to walk to many sites without much planning.

The Hampton Inn Chelsea provides a complimentary breakfast, with coffee and tea available 24/7, and is conveniently located near subway lines for easy access to various parts of the city. Some rooms include a coffee maker and complimentary water bottles.
The Hampton Inn Soho offers a complimentary breakfast and free coffee/tea throughout the day. There is also free internet and a business center with computers for guest use.
The hotel includes a free breakfast buffet and offers breakfast to-go bags. It is located within walking distance to many attractions and has a subway entrance one block away.

The Hampton Inn Seaport/Financial District offers a complimentary breakfast, and is conveniently located near subway stations and various downtown attractions, making it easy to explore the area without extensive planning. The hotel is in a safe, walkable area with many shops and restaurants nearby.

Helmsley Middletowne is an older hotel with clean, spacious rooms and a complimentary continental breakfast, located within walking distance of many attractions like Times Square and Central Park. Some rooms have kitchenettes with a fridge and sink and the hotel offers delivery from local restaurants.
The hotel is centrally located, within a 5-minute walk to Times Square or Central Park, and close to key subway entrances. Some reviewers mention the concierge service is excellent.

The Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea is centrally located near subway stations and within walking distance of major attractions like Times Square and Macy's. The hotel offers amenities like a microwave, fridge, free Wi-Fi, and a business center, providing convenience for guests who prefer not to plan extensively.

The Hilton Garden Inn is in an excellent location, near a subway, Macy's, and the Empire State Building and many reviewers noted they didn't have to plan much to get around. Some reviewers recommended it as a great base to explore New York, especially for first-time visitors.

The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square offers a convenient location with many nearby restaurants, a connecting bistro, Pigalle, and a grocery store across the street. Some reviewers mention the availability of in-room amenities such as a microwave and refrigerator.

The hotel is conveniently located near multiple subway lines, providing easy access to various parts of the city, and is within walking distance of several neighborhoods, restaurants, and shops. The hotel offers amenities such as free internet, a business center, and complimentary coffee and cookies.

The Hilton New York is centrally located, clean, and a good base for touring New York, with taxis available 24/7. If staying on the executive level, there is access to the Club Lounge for cheese, finger foods, and continental breakfast.
The Hilton Times Square is centrally located near many shops, restaurants, and theaters, with easy access to public transportation. The hotel offers amenities for both business and leisure travelers.

The Holiday Inn Express Fifth Avenue offers complimentary breakfast, free internet, and a central location near Times Square and other attractions, making it convenient for sightseeing. Rooms are small but clean, and the hotel is considered a good value for its location.
The Holiday Inn Express Times Square provides free breakfast and internet. The hotel is located near Times Square, Penn Station, and Port Authority.
The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast, and free coffee and tea are available all day. There is also free internet available, and the staff can book events for you.

The Holiday Inn is in a convenient location, close to the subway, Chinatown, and Little Italy, and has a helpful staff for directions and tips. The hotel offers basic amenities, a small gym, and nearby shopping and restaurants.

The Holiday Inn Midtown is noted for its convenient location near Central Park and multiple subway lines, making it easy to explore the city. While some areas are dated, it offers clean rooms and a rooftop pool (seasonal).

The hotel is in a great central location with easy access to subway stations, Penn Station, Times Square, and many attractions within walking distance. The hotel is clean with a friendly staff, but the rooms are small and there can be long elevator waits.

Hotel 17 is in a great location within walking distance of many restaurants and cafes, close to subway, and close to several parks making it easy to explore Manhattan. Rooms are small and some have shared bathrooms which are cleaned regularly.
Hotel 31 is centrally located, near the subway and many attractions. It's clean and quiet, with some rooms offering a view of the Empire State Building.

Hotel 373 is centrally located near attractions like the Empire State Building and Times Square, with a Starbucks connected to the lobby. The rooms are small, clean, and modern, but lack amenities like a large closet.

Hotel 41 includes complimentary breakfast with bagels, pastries, juice and coffee, and free DVD rentals, and is centrally located near Times Square and many subway lines. The hotel has a friendly staff that is helpful with information and directions.
Hotel 99 is located on the Upper West Side and is close to the subway. Some rooms have a queen bed and private bathroom, flat screen TV, writing desk and free Internet access.

The Hotel Beacon is located in the Upper West Side, close to Central Park and the subway, with options for markets and restaurants nearby; rooms include kitchenettes with cookware, a refrigerator, and coffee maker. The hotel does not have a restaurant but a diner is next door, and there is no room service.

Hotel Chandler is in an excellent midtown location near the Empire State Building and subway lines, with small but clean rooms that include amenities such as free tea/coffee in the lobby, Frette towels, Aveda bath products, and comfortable beds; the friendly staff is helpful in providing directions and recommendations. Some reviewers mention that free internet is available, and the location is ideal for walking around Manhattan.
Hotel Deauville is in an excellent location, within walking distance of many attractions and near subway lines. The staff is friendly and helpful, offering recommendations and directions.

The hotel offers a complimentary continental breakfast with a variety of options like pastries, bagels, yogurt, and coffee. It also has a 24-hour rooftop terrace and computers in the basement for guest use.

The Hotel Elysee includes complimentary breakfast and complimentary wine with snacks in the afternoon. It has a comfortable lounge available for guests, computers, and is located within walking distance to shopping and attractions.

The hotel has a restaurant, a rooftop bar and pool, and provides room service and complimentary breakfast, though some found the breakfast service slow and limited. The hotel is located in the Meatpacking District, steps away from many restaurants and bars.

Hotel Giraffe offers complimentary breakfast, evening wine and cheese, and coffee/tea all day, removing the need to plan for these meals. Takeout from nearby restaurants can be delivered, and it is within walking distance to shops and restaurants.

Hotel Grand Union is a budget-friendly option in Midtown Manhattan, steps away from the Empire State Building and subway, with clean basic rooms, though some rooms can be small and noisy. A cafe is attached to the hotel.
Hotel Indigo is in a great location, close to Times Square, Herald Square, the Meatpacking District, and three subway lines. The hotel also has a restaurant, Blu, with great food.
Hotel Mela is centrally located near Times Square and close to transportation and entertainment. The hotel is located near restaurants, a grocery store, and shops.

Hotel Metro is praised for its central location near transportation, attractions, and shopping, with many reviews highlighting the complimentary breakfast, 24-hour coffee, and helpful staff for planning activities. However, some guests noted potential drawbacks such as small rooms, street noise, and limited on-site dining options.
Hotel Newton is near the subway, express train, shops, and some 24-hour establishments, but does not have a restaurant. Some reviewers felt safe in the neighborhood.
The hotel offers a complimentary continental breakfast, and room service is available. There are also many bars and restaurants in the surrounding Lower East Side neighborhood.

The hotel is conveniently located near multiple subway lines, providing easy access to various parts of the city. The hotel's location in the Financial District offers a quieter environment, with some restaurants and shops open late, though options may be limited on weekends.

The St. James Hotel is located close to Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, and subway stations, making it easy to walk to shows, shopping, and dining. The Cranberry Buffet and other delis are nearby, so you don't have to go far for food.

The Stanford Hotel offers a complimentary continental breakfast with bagels, pastries, cereal, fruit, juice, coffee, and tea, and is conveniently located near Penn Station and a subway. Some reviewers noted that the breakfast area is small and gets crowded and that the breakfast is very basic.

Hotel Wales offers a complimentary continental breakfast and 24-hour coffee/tea in the lounge, making mornings easier, but note that the breakfast room is sometimes used for private functions. The hotel's location is convenient to museums and Central Park.

The Hudson Hotel has multiple bars, including a nightclub, rooftop bar, and library bar, and is near the Columbus Circle subway station. The lobby and bars can be lively and crowded, and some rooms overlook a courtyard that can be noisy.

INK48 offers complimentary breakfast and evening wine service; the hotel also has an in-room spa service. The hotel can provide restaurant recommendations and offers delivery from the Market Diner 24/7.

The Inn New York City is a small, well-appointed inn located on a quiet street on the Upper West Side, near the subway, Central Park, and Lincoln Center, with kitchens stocked with complimentary snacks and drinks that are replenished daily. The innkeepers are available but unobtrusive and provide fresh pastries, fruit, and newspapers every day.

The Intercontinental Barclay is in a great location with easy access to many attractions and subway lines. The concierge and bell staff are helpful with directions and transportation, and the rooms are clean and comfortable.

The hotel offers packages that include room, afternoon high tea, and breakfasts; the hotel also has a bar, restaurant, and spa. The hotel provides complimentary bicycles and a car service that travels within a 10-block radius.
The Kitano is near Grand Central Station, allowing easy access to transportation and attractions. Some reviewers mention that it is quiet, clean, and has a serene atmosphere.

The hotel is centrally located near many attractions, including the Empire State Building and Times Square, and offers free breakfast. Some reviews mention the hotel offers free internet, free phone calls within the US, and a gym.

Lafayette House is located in a convenient downtown neighborhood close to many restaurants, and is near Washington Square Park, the Children's Museum of Art and Joe's Pub. The hotel offers free Wi-Fi and some rooms have kitchenettes.

Le Parker Meridien has multiple restaurants including Norma's, a breakfast place, a burger joint, and a French restaurant open until 3 am, there is also a Starbucks across the street. There is a rooftop pool, and close access to Central Park.

The Library Hotel provides an upscale bistro, lively bar, free Wi-Fi, free gym passes, and complimentary pastries, wine, and cheese. The Library Hotel also includes free continental breakfast, coffee, and tea served 24/7.
The Loews Regency is in a convenient location, close to shops, museums, and Central Park, and near subway stations. The hotel offers amenities such as a gym, and the hotel is pet-friendly.

The Lowell is a small, intimate hotel on the Upper East Side with spacious rooms, kitchenettes, and luxurious bathrooms. The hotel offers excellent service, including quick room service, a helpful concierge, and a staff that remembers guests' preferences.
Located in the Time Warner building, this hotel gives you access to basics including reasonable food, and a bank. The concierge can arrange transportation and dining.

The Milford Plaza is centrally located near Times Square, Broadway shows, restaurants and transportation, making it easy to get around; however, there are no dining options at the hotel. The hotel has a gym, a business center, and offers a club room upgrade with free breakfast and internet.

The Millenium Hilton is a well-connected hotel with subway access that allows easy access to all parts of the city, and is near many Tribeca restaurants and the South Street Seaport; the hotel is primarily aimed towards business travelers and features an indoor pool, gym, and airline check-in terminal in the lobby. Rooms feature LCD TVs and are generally clean and comfortable.

The Millennium Broadway is centrally located near Times Square and Broadway, making it easy to access many attractions by foot. The hotel offers amenities like concierge service and parking, with several dining options and a Starbucks nearby.

The Millennium UN Plaza is located near Grand Central station with easy access to subways and buses, but requires some walking to get to shops and sights; several reviewers recommend the hotel for its views of the city. Note that the hotel restaurant only serves breakfast.

The Moderne Hotel is in a great location, close to Times Square and Central Park, with many restaurants and attractions within walking distance. It's a smaller hotel with no food service but offers free coffee/tea and internet access and is close to subway stops.

Morgans Hotel includes complimentary continental breakfast at Asia de Cuba, as well as free tea and coffee service in the Living Room on the 4th floor. The hotel is centrally located near Grand Central Station, the Empire State Building, and Times Square.

Murray Hill East Suites is centrally located near Grand Central Station, Times Square, and other attractions, making it easy to explore Manhattan without much planning. The hotel has spacious rooms with kitchenettes, nearby restaurants, grocery stores, and transportation options.

The Murray Hill Inn is in a great location, close to cafes, restaurants, subways, and many touristy spots, making it easy to walk to sites like the Empire State Building, Macy's, and Times Square. Some reviewers note the rooms are small, basic, and no-frills.

The hotel has a Starbucks and a restaurant, Roy's, on-site, and offers room service; a hot breakfast buffet is also available. The hotel also has amenities such as a pool, gym, and a concierge who can make reservations and help with tickets.

The Marriott East Side offers a concierge lounge with free food and non-alcoholic drinks, a restaurant, and is located near many restaurants, bars, and coffee shops. It is centrally located near Grand Central station, making it easy to access different parts of the city.

The Marriott Marquis is conveniently located in Times Square with restaurants, bars, shops, a Starbucks, a theatre, and subway access. The hotel is large and modern, with glass elevators and a lobby on the 8th floor.

The Executive Lounge provides free breakfast, lunch, snacks, drinks, newspapers, and computers/internet. Executive rooms include access to the Executive Lounge, providing complimentary meals and refreshments throughout the day.

The Night Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and major attractions, with a complimentary continental breakfast; some reviewers mention easy access to transportation and nearby shops/delis. The hotel has a trendy, small bar, with some reviewers noting that the restaurant is currently closed for refurbishment.

The Novotel Times Square is in a central location, close to Broadway shows and Times Square, and is near subway stations for easy access to other parts of Manhattan. The hotel has a bar and restaurant with views of Times Square, but some reviewers noted that there are many other dining options nearby.

Off Soho Suites offers apartment-like suites with kitchens, allowing guests to prepare their own meals. The hotel is located near multiple subway lines, providing easy access to various parts of the city.

The Omni Berkshire Place is praised for its central location near shops and sights, making it easy to explore without much planning. Select Guest members receive complimentary morning beverages and newspapers delivered to their room.
The hotel is located in the Upper West Side, close to subway stations, Central Park, museums, restaurants, and grocery stores. A 24-hour diner across the street offers room service.

Park 79 is in a convenient location on the Upper West Side, close to Central Park, museums, and subway stations, with many restaurants and shops nearby. Coffee is offered in the lobby in the morning and the hotel offers free Wifi.
The Park Central Hotel is in an excellent location, close to many attractions, public transportation, shops, and restaurants. Tour buses stop near the hotel and the concierge can help with bookings.

The Park South Hotel offers a complimentary breakfast buffet with a variety of options and is conveniently located near the subway. It also has a restaurant and bar, The Black Duck, and a business center with computers and internet access.

The Peninsula New York offers impeccable service, with staff anticipating guest needs and providing complimentary amenities. The hotel has a pool, spa, rooftop bar, and fitness center and is centrally located for easy access to shopping, dining, and attractions.

The Phillips Club offers studios, one, and two-bedroom apartments with kitchens, allowing guests to prepare their own meals. Balducci's gourmet market is conveniently located downstairs, and the hotel is near a subway entrance for easy access to transportation.

The Plaza Athenee has a residential feel, with an attentive staff, concierge service, and good room service. The hotel is located in a quiet area close to Central Park, Madison Avenue, and Lexington Avenue.

This hotel is centrally located near many attractions and the subway, with many staff members being helpful. Some packages include breakfast, and the restaurant is open 24 hours, although some found it slow.

The hotel includes complimentary continental breakfast with fresh juice, coffee, bagels, cereal, yogurt, and fruit and has free wireless internet and a business center. Tour tickets can be purchased at the hotel and transportation to and from the airport can be arranged.

The Red Roof Inn Manhattan is in a central location near transportation, shops, and restaurants, and offers a complimentary breakfast. Some reviewers mention the small size of the breakfast room and slow elevators, but overall the hotel is considered a good value and a convenient base for exploring the city.
Hotel 57 has a restaurant and bar, and is located near a subway station, shopping, and Central Park, with a great diner next door. The concierge and door staff are helpful and knowledgeable.

The Renaissance Times Square is centrally located near many attractions and subways, and offers helpful staff and concierge services to help plan outings. The hotel is also known for reserved New Year's Eve celebrations with views of the Ball Drop.
The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast, and social hours with light snacks from Monday to Wednesday. The rooms have kitchens and appliances so you can prepare your own food.

The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park has a club level where food, drinks and concierge services are available throughout the day. Located in Battery Park, it's near the ferries to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island.

The Rockefeller Center Hotel's location is ideal for sightseeing with walking distance to major attractions/shopping and several subway routes, and the hotel is near many restaurants. There are also check-in kiosks, free internet access, and extra towels, soaps, and coffee/tea available.

The Roger Smith Hotel is centrally located near Grand Central Station, subways, shops, and restaurants, with a friendly staff and a bar/restaurant. The hotel offers spacious rooms, free Wi-Fi, and a complimentary continental breakfast.

The Roger Williams Hotel is centrally located in Midtown Manhattan, close to subways, shopping, and tourist attractions like the Empire State Building. The hotel is known for its friendly staff, modern decor, and comfortable beds, but some rooms can be small and may have extra service fees.

Room Mate Grace is in the heart of Manhattan and Times Square, has a continental breakfast with extended hours until noon, and the hotel has a pool, sauna, steam room, and gym. You can buy snacks and drinks at the front desk/kiosk.

The Royalton Hotel is centrally located near Times Square, Fifth Avenue, and major transportation hubs, making it easy to access various attractions without extensive planning. Concierge services are available to provide recommendations and make reservations.

The Salisbury Hotel is in a central location near popular attractions, and it has an inexpensive continental breakfast for $4, making it easy to start the day without planning. It is also near several subway stops and has many restaurants that deliver.

San Carlos Hotel is in a great midtown location with a subway stop nearby, and it is within walking distance to many attractions such as the Rockefeller Center and Times Square. The hotel offers a complimentary continental breakfast.

Seafarers International House is located near Union Square and a major subway hub, making it easy to get around Manhattan. It offers basic, clean rooms at an affordable price, with free internet access and nearby supermarkets and restaurants.

The Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers is in an ideal location for sightseeing with close proximity to Times Square, Central Park, and subway lines. The hotel also offers a concierge service, and some reviewers mention convenient features such as a gym and a club room with complimentary breakfast.
The Skyline Hotel is conveniently located near Times Square, shops, and restaurants. The hotel is near a deli and has a restaurant, making it easy to get food.

The Smyth Tribeca is conveniently located near the subway, making it easy to access different parts of the city without extensive planning. The hotel is surrounded by numerous restaurants, cafes, and bars, providing plenty of dining options nearby.
The Sofitel New York has a central location and is within walking distance of many attractions. They offer great service, which includes everything from housekeeping to late check-out.

The Soho Grand has a hip lobby, bar scene, and lounge with a great location near restaurants and shops, but some reviews mention that lounge seats are often reserved. It has room service, a business center, and staff that are generally helpful.

Soho House provides free access to its events during your stay and has a pool table, table football, and board games in the bar, as well as free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel. The hotel also offers useful magazines and interesting mini-bar items.
The Stay Hotel is located very close to Times Square and public transportation. Some guests enjoyed the bar downstairs and easy access to broadway shows.

The Alex Hotel offers suites equipped with full kitchens including a Sub-Zero fridge/freezer, stove, and dishwasher and is located near Grand Central station, the UN, and grocery stores like Amish Market. The hotel has a fitness center, a restaurant, and offers room service; some packages include breakfast.
The Belvedere Hotel is in a great location, close to most attractions and theaters. It is also within walking distance of many fine restaurants, shopping, and the subway.

The Benjamin is located near the subway and various restaurants, with rooms that have a mini-kitchen including a full-size refrigerator and microwave. The hotel has a concierge desk that provides information for trips.

The Blakely Hotel offers complimentary breakfast, a kitchenette in the room, and is centrally located. The hotel also offers services such as concierge and doormen that will help with printing boarding passes and transporting luggage.

The Bowery Hotel is praised for its excellent and friendly staff, convenient location near shops and restaurants, and comfortable bar/lounge area. Some reviewers note the availability of room service and the hotel's ability to provide recommendations for local attractions and dining.
The Bryant Park Hotel is centrally located, near many attractions, with friendly staff, a Cellar Bar, and the Koi restaurant. The hotel has a lot of free activities in Bryant Park.
The Carlton Hotel is in a centralized location with subway access and delis nearby. The hotel rooms have comfortable beds, large TVs, and stunning views of the Empire State building.

The Carlyle offers personalized service, with staff known for remembering guest preferences and attending to details; the hotel provides amenities like complimentary newspapers, and turndown service. The concierge is helpful with securing restaurant reservations and theatre tickets.
The Franklin Hotel offers complimentary breakfast, evening wine and cheese, and 24/7 coffee and tea. The hotel is near the subway and within walking distance of Central Park and museums.

The French Quarters Guest Apartments includes a continental breakfast and is located on Restaurant Row near many restaurants and bars. The hotel offers newspapers with local events, weather, and trivia.

The Gem Hotel Chelsea is in a great location near restaurants and the subway, with friendly staff, free Wi-Fi, and in-room coffee makers. The rooms are small but clean, modern, and well-maintained, with amenities like flat-screen TVs and comfortable beds.

The Gem Hotel is in a convenient location, within walking distance of Times Square, Penn Station, and Macy's; some reviewers mention easy access to subway lines and a gas station next door where you can get a cab anytime. The hotel offers amenities like free wireless internet, coffee-making facilities, and vending machines in the basement.

The Gem Hotel Soho is located near multiple subway lines and within walking distance of several neighborhoods including Little Italy and Chinatown. The hotel rooms include amenities such as free Wi-Fi, a refrigerator, and a microwave.
The Grant Hotel is a budget hotel with small, basic rooms, shared bathrooms, and amenities like TV and AC. It is located in a safe neighborhood, close to the subway, restaurants, and Central Park.
The Hampton Inn offers a central location near attractions, free breakfast, and 24/7 access to coffee, tea, and hot chocolate. It is also located close to subways and tour bus stops.

The Helmsley Carlton House Hotel is located on the upper east side of Manhattan, one block from Central Park, close to subways, shopping, and restaurants, with a short cab ride to Times Square and Museum Mile. The hotel offers spacious rooms with sitting areas and kitchenettes, and some rooms have balconies overlooking Central Park.
This hotel is in a great location near Central Park, the subway, and many attractions. A few reviewers noted responsive staff and readily available cabs.

This hotel is in a central location near public transportation, but note that it has minimal services, no restaurant, and no room service; the free coffee and tea are only available at certain times. Some rooms include a free safe, and there are lockers available for $2 per use after check-out.

Hotel 91 is located in the heart of Manhattan's Chinatown, close to subways for easy access to other parts of the city, but not within walking distance to Midtown attractions. There are free coffee and tea facilities available, and several reviewers mention the comfortable beds.

The Hotel at Times Square offers a complimentary continental breakfast, free wi-fi, and is centrally located near many attractions, including Times Square and Rockefeller Center. It is also close to subway lines.

The Inn at Irving Place offers complimentary breakfast and afternoon tea service, with options for in-room dining. The staff is noted for being helpful in arranging surprises and providing attentive service.
The Iroquois is a smaller, centrally-located boutique hotel with a library and is within walking distance to many attractions. The hotel has a restaurant, Triomphe, and offers room service.

The Jane Hotel offers very small, cabin-style rooms with shared bathrooms, and provides amenities like free wifi, TV, and bottled water. It's located in the West Village, close to subways, restaurants, and attractions.

The Kimberly Hotel is centrally located near Rockefeller Center and Times Square, and has a helpful concierge service and easy access to the subway. Many reviewers mention the doormen are especially friendly and helpful.
The Lombardy offers spacious rooms with kitchenettes and is located near restaurants, diners, delis, bars, and a subway station. Room service is available from a nearby restaurant.

The London NYC is centrally located near Central Park, Times Square, and various shops, making it easy to walk to many attractions. Concierge services are available for last-minute dinner reservations and local recommendations.

The Lucerne is located on the Upper West Side, close to Central Park, museums, restaurants and subways, making it easy to get around the city. Some found the staff helpful in providing directions and recommendations.

The Manhattan Club has a great location near Central Park and Times Square with subway access, and the rooms include kitchenettes with microwaves and refrigerators. There is also a business center and owner's lounge with free coffee and tea.

The Mansfield Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Grand Central Station, with many shops and restaurants, and offers complimentary breakfast, coffee and tea, and Wi-Fi. Rooms range in size from extremely small to suites, with some noise from street traffic and air conditioning.

The Marcel at Gramercy is well-located near subways, buses, restaurants, and pharmacies, making it convenient and is near a neighborhood hot spot, lively bar/restaurant. Breakfast at the hotel is convenient, and there is free computer and internet access, along with free coffee in the 10th-floor lounge.

The Maritime Hotel has multiple restaurants and bars, including Italian and Japanese options, with room service available from both. The hotel also offers a business center with free printing and a gym.

The Mark is located on the Upper East Side, close to museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping; the concierge can help obtain show tickets and restaurant reservations. Complimentary breakfast was included in the price of the hotel.

The Marmara Manhattan offers apartment-style rooms with full kitchens, allowing guests to prepare their own meals. It is located in a residential area with grocery stores and restaurants nearby, and provides amenities like free internet and daily delivery of the New York Times.
The hotel is centrally located with easy access to subway lines and within walking distance of many attractions and restaurants. The hotel offers a grab-and-go breakfast.

The Mercer is located in SoHo, near shopping, restaurants, and subway lines, and offers amenities such as free access to a nearby Equinox gym, free mini-bar items (excluding alcohol), and a lobby bar exclusively for hotel guests. Guests have noted the friendly and helpful staff, room service, and comfortable lobby as features that contribute to a relaxing stay.

The Michelangelo Hotel is in a great location near Times Square and Broadway, with large, quiet rooms, and offers complimentary coffee and pastries in the morning. The hotel is near many New York landmarks, such as Times Square, 5th Avenue, Central Park, and Rockefeller Center.

The Milburn Hotel offers suites with kitchenettes and complimentary breakfast on weekdays, so you can easily have meals in your room. The hotel is conveniently located near grocery stores, delis, and restaurants, giving you easy access to food and supplies without extensive planning.

The Muse Hotel is located a half block from Times Square with guests mentioning its central location; a wine reception is held each evening, and complimentary coffee is served each morning. Staff will also arrange car service, but there is no spa.

The Helmsley is in a great central location, near Grand Central station and walking distance to many attractions. Guests recommend this hotel as a good base, but note there are few amenities, and many food options nearby.

This hotel has a great location with many attractions within walking distance including Times Square, Macy's, and the Empire State Building, and there is a subway station close to the hotel. Tick Tock Diner is attached to the hotel and is open 24 hours.

The Pierre is known for its excellent service, with staff often going the extra mile, and a convenient location across from Central Park. Some reviewers mention amenities such as a complimentary Rolls Royce, elevator operators, and concierge services for arranging tickets and recommendations.

The hotel's location is convenient to shopping, restaurants, nightlife, and Central Park, and is also located near a subway station. The hotel can provide anything you want and has a touch screen that you can use to control features such as climate control, television and lights.
The hotel is in a great location, close to the subway, Times Square, and many restaurants. With the rooftop garden, and bars nearby it makes a great place for people who are out and about.

The hotel offers complimentary continental breakfast and an evening reception with drinks and hors d’oeuvres. Room service is available, and the hotel is located near Times Square with access to restaurants and transportation.
The hotel offers a Club Level with multiple daily food and drink servings, offering a convenient dining option. Room service is available with prompt delivery.

The Roosevelt Hotel is in a prime location, close to Grand Central Station and many attractions. The lobby is beautiful and there are several dining options on-site, though some found the food expensive.

The Sherry-Netherland provides a high level of service, including doormen, elevator operators, twice-daily maid service, and complimentary breakfast and beverages. The hotel is centrally located near Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping, and restaurants, with room service available from Cipriani's.

The Shoreham Hotel is centrally located near shopping, museums, food, and the subway, and it offers complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby 24/7. Some reviewers noted the availability of free internet and newspapers, as well as a gym.

The St. Regis offers butler service, handling tasks like bringing coffee/tea, ironing clothes, and shining shoes, plus a command center in the room to control lights, climate, and request services. The hotel is centrally located near shopping and Central Park.

The hotel has great amenities downstairs with a packed bar scene, and the Standard Grill is open until 4 PM. There are several lounge spaces on the ground floor, both indoors and out, with the largest being outdoors under the High Line.

The Surrey is located near Central Park and has suites with kitchenettes, making it convenient for families and those who prefer to prepare their own meals. The hotel also offers room service from Cafe Boulud.
The Sylvan Guest House is located in Harlem, near a grocery store and multiple subway lines that provide access to Manhattan. The guest house offers apartments with well-equipped kitchens.

The Time Hotel is in a great location near Times Square and subways, with modern, clean rooms and friendly staff, making it a good base for exploring the city without needing to plan much, although some rooms are small and amenities can be inconsistent. Breakfast is available and the hotel is near many attractions, entertainment and food.

The Waldorf Astoria is centrally located, near Grand Central Station, Central Park, Fifth Avenue, and Times Square, making it easy to access many attractions. The Greyline bus tour stops at the door, and there is a subway nearby.

The Westin New York Times Square offers a great location, close to theaters, restaurants, and transportation, making it easy to access attractions without extensive planning. The hotel is connected to a movie theater and Starbucks, providing convenient entertainment and dining options.

Hotel Thirty Thirty is centrally located in Midtown Manhattan near the Empire State Building, 5th Avenue, and the subway, making it easy to reach many attractions. There is a bar/restaurant, though some found it pricey, and the Crooked Knife across the road is recommended by multiple reviewers.
The hotel is located in the Lower East Side, close to subways, restaurants, and shops. Since the hotel is modern and some facilities are not fully operational, some services may be limited.

The Travel Inn is conveniently located near Times Square, Port Authority, and various transportation options, with a deli and other food options nearby, making it easy to get around and find necessities. The hotel offers basic but clean rooms, free parking, and an outdoor pool, providing value for money in Manhattan.
The Tribeca Grand offers packages including free drinks at the bar and free breakfasts, and the concierge can help with restaurant reservations. There is a bar/lounge in the hotel.

The Trump International Hotel & Tower is praised for its excellent location near Central Park, Columbus Circle, and subway lines, making it easy to get around the city without a car. Many reviewers also appreciated the fully equipped kitchens in the suites, allowing for convenient meal preparation and reducing the need to plan for every meal.

The Tudor Hotel is located a few blocks from Grand Central Station and has a bus stop right outside, providing convenient transportation options. The hotel rooms have amenities such as an in-room coffee maker.

The Avalon Vincci is centrally located near the Empire State Building, Macy's, and subway lines, and offers large rooms, and a breakfast buffet, but some past guests mention issues with air conditioning, broken appliances, and spotty customer service. Some guests also mention that the rooms have mini bars, but they are not always functional.

W The Court is in a central location, close to Grand Central station and easy to get around; the staff is friendly, and the service is accommodating. There are several restaurants nearby, but room service has limited options.

The W Tuscany offers a complimentary Acura car service within Manhattan, allowing for spontaneous trips, and is conveniently located near Grand Central Station for easy access to transportation and a variety of dining options. Some reviewers noted that the hotel shares amenities with the W Court next door, offering access to more facilities.
The W Times Square is centrally located near theaters, shopping, dining, and public transportation. The hotel offers amenities such as room service, a restaurant, and a bar.

The W Union Square is conveniently located near Union Square's subway station and the hotel’s lobby bar provides a space to relax; the hotel also offers room service. Guests can find nearby markets and drugstores, and the concierge can offer recommendations and directions.

The Waldorf Towers offers a concierge service, a lounge with complimentary continental breakfast and afternoon hors d'oeuvres, and room service. Its central location provides easy access to many of NYC's attractions.

The Wall Street Inn offers a complimentary continental breakfast and is near a street with restaurants; coffee and tea are available all day. The hotel is located in a quiet area, especially on weekends, but is still close to subway stations.

The Warwick Hotel is centrally located near Times Square, Central Park, and various attractions, making it easy to get around without much planning. The hotel offers a restaurant and bar, and is near many other dining options.

The Washington Jefferson Hotel is in a great location within walking distance to many attractions, with several bistros and bars on the same street; there is a Japanese restaurant in the hotel. Some reviewers found the rooms to be very small and noisy, and there is no coffee in the room or lobby.

The Washington Square Hotel includes a complimentary continental breakfast of fruit, bagels, and muffins. The North Square restaurant is located in the hotel, with the option of ordering cooked extras.

The Wellington Hotel is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, near Central Park and Times Square, with a subway stop conveniently located nearby. Some reviewers mention that it is easy to walk to many attractions and that tour buses pick up on the same block.

The hotel offers free breakfast, a concierge service, and an owners lounge with continental breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvres. The location is central with access to buses and subway lines, close to Central Park, Carnegie Hall, and various restaurants.

The hotel provides a complimentary hot breakfast, free bottled water, and a microwave and refrigerator in every room. The Wingate is centrally located near Penn Station, Times Square, and Macy's, and close to many subway lines.
The Wolcott Hotel offers a central location near attractions like the Empire State Building, Macy's, and Times Square. Some reviews mention included coffee and muffins in the morning.

This is an apartment-style hotel with kitchenettes and no daily maid service, located near the subway and Central Park. The front desk has limited hours, and guests need to request cleaning in advance.

The Wyndham Garden Hotel has a Starbucks in the lobby, a restaurant, and a bar, and offers complimentary breakfast. It is located near Penn Station, Times Square, and other attractions and the staff are very helpful and friendly.
